rComments: I don't know what everyone else is talking about when they say she's bad or there aren't any study guides. I think she is a great professor yes she tries to get students involved but hey at least she's trying. And you don't need any study guides it's all essays she gives you the prompts. Just show up to lecture and discussion.

I was very excited for this class going in because I thought the subject matter was interesting. That said, I slept through this class. She tried to get conversation going and it was dead the entire time. She never told you what she wanted. She "graded" based on "improvement" but she was able to articulate what you need to do to improve. Avoid!

Maria tries very hard to get the class involved, with very little success. you can tell she knows a lot about the subject, but is too dry and boring for anything interesting to come out and appeal to students. Overall, she is a very easy grader, and the class is an easy A.

The two comments before this are spot on. Poor Professor does very little in depth analysis in lecture, and when it comes down to class discussion, she asks vapid questions which are already answered by the footnotes. Directions on assignments were flimsy, and there's no study guide for mid-term and final exams.
There is no study guide for Mid-Terms and Final. Lectures the whole time and doesn't prepare you for the exams. Test are very difficult, since you don't know what to memorize.

Basically just summarizes the reading, very little analysis or deeper info. Lectures aren't well-structured, she doesn't seem like a confident speaker. I think she knows a lot about what she teaches, but doesn't know how to communicate it to the class.

She is a very sweet teacher, and makes the books much easier to understand considering it is a Shakespeare class! She both explains and analyzes the plays scene by scene, and then shows movie clips in order to help you understand the way the play is acted out. She is very knowledgable and will be there to help anytime!

Lectures were a little slow sometimes, especially in the warm afternoons but Maria is very passionate about what she teaches. Very available during office hours, helps with papers, chooses great texts and is extremely sweet.
She seemed sweet and like she was trying, but this class was just boring. Lectures lacked structure and went absolutely nowhere. A lot of vague summarizing, no analysis. A lemon of a class.
